intro: Paepalanthus moaensis, commonly known as the Moa's firebush, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Paepalanthus moaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
